metadata.subject: Geography

exercises.title: Answer the following questions briefly.
exercises.content:
1. Answer the following questions briefly.

(a) What are the three components of a map?

(b) What are the four cardinal directions?

(c) What do you mean by the term ‘the scale of the map’?

(d) How are maps more helpful than a globe?

(e) Distinguish between a map and a plan.

(f) Which map provides detailed information?

(g) How do symbols help in reading maps?

exercises.title: Tick the correct answers.
exercises.content:
2. Tick the correct answers.

(a) Maps showing distribution of forests are

(i) Physical map (ii) Thematic Map (iii) Political map

(b) The blue colour is used for showing

(i) Water bodies (ii) Mountains (iii) Plains

(c) A compass is used –

(i) To show symbols

(ii) To find the main direction

(iii) To measure distance

(d) A scale is necessary

(i) For a map (ii) For a sketch (iii) For symbols

exercises.title: Draw a plan of your classroom
exercises.content: 1. Draw a plan of your classroom and show the teacher’s table, blackboard, desks, door and windows.

exercises.title: Draw a sketch of your school
exercises.content:
2. Draw a sketch of your school and locate the following :

(a) the principal’s room (b) your classroom

(c) the playground (d) the library

(e) some big trees (f) drinking water

exercises.title: Make the plan of a fun-park
exercises.content: 1. Make the plan (in the space given below) of a fun-park where you can enjoy several activities : for example swings, slides, see-saw, merry-go-round, boating, swimming, looking into funny mirrors, etc. or anything else that you can think of.
